org.usfirst.frc.team1100.robot.commands.drivecommands

Class EulerApprox

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1100.robot.commands.drivecommands.EulerApprox

  • public class EulerApprox
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for use wherever a Euler Approximation is needed
    Author:
    Joshua-Gordon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EulerApprox(double[] s)
      Accepts a starting x and y coordinate in a 2d array

      Gets the current velocity according to the Euler Approximation

    • Constructor Detail

      • EulerApprox

        public EulerApprox(double[] s)
        Accepts a starting x and y coordinate in a 2d array
        Parameters:
        s - the starting x and y coordinate in a 2d array

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step(double dtime,
                 double[] ac)
        Step forward the Euler Approximation by a time, with a set of x and y accelerations.
        Parameters:
        dtime - the time since the last step or start of the command if this is the first step.
        ac - a 2d array of acceleration. The 0 index for x acceleration, and the 1 index for y acceleration.

      • getCurrentVelocity

        public double[] getCurrentVelocity()
        Gets the current velocity according to the Euler Approximation
        Returns:
        the approximated current velocity

      • getDisplacement

        public double[] getDisplacement()
        Gets the current displacement according to the Euler Approximation
        Returns:
        the approximated current displacement
